title: Black Bean Burger

Patty Ingredients: 2 cans (14.5 ounces each) seasoned black beans

steps: Drain, but do not rinse, the black beans.
Place the beans in a bowl and use a fork to mash them until mostly broken up, with some whole beans remaining.
Add the breadcrumbs, onion, egg, chili powder, salt, pepper, and hot sauce, stirring until combined. Let the mixture sit for 5 minutes.
Heat 1–2 tablespoons olive oil and an equal amount of butter in a skillet over medium–low heat.
Form the bean mixture into patties slightly larger than the buns.
Cook the patties in the skillet for about 5 minutes on the first side.
Flip the patties, top each with two slices of Swiss cheese, and cook for another 5 minutes or until heated through (cover with a lid if needed to melt the cheese).
Grill the buns on a griddle with butter until golden.
Spread mayonnaise and hot sauce on the buns, place the patties on the bottoms, top with lettuce and tomato, and finish with the bun tops.
